intro: Centaurea regia var. regia, commonly known as the royal centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom from summer to autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and grasslands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
